acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96-hour LC50=0.0002mg/L of Crustacea (Amphipod) (EHC198, 1998).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was set as Category 3 based on rat (female) LD50 value: 876mg/kg (Agricultural-Chemicals abstracts).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: It was set as Category 4 based on Rat LC50 (4 hours) value: 3.1mg/L (Agricultural-Chemicals abstracts).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale:
SPECIES: Rat (female)
ENDPOINT: LD50
VALUE: 485 mg/kg
REFERENCE SOURCE: Agricultural Chemicals abstracts

carcinogenicity.rationale: Since it was classified into A4 (ACGIH, 2003) according to ACGIH, it was considered as the outside of Category.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1, Classified into Category 1, since acute toxicity was Category 1 and not rapidly degrading (BOD: 0% (existing chemical safety inspections data)), though less bio-accumulative (BCF=46.9 (existing chemical safety inspections data)).

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Since there are only negative or slightly positive in vitro test data (Agricultural-Chemicals abstracts), the substance cannot be classified

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: The firing points is 169 degC (our database), and even if it contacts the normal temperature air, it does not ignite.

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: In the peroral administration reproduction study using rat, and the pregnancy peroral administration study using rat and rabbit, there was no reproductive toxicity in the dose causing general toxicity of parent animals (all were from Agricultural-Chemicals abstracts). So it was considered as on the outside of Categry.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Since change of the eye which is adapted for criteria for diagnosis of irritation was not admitted in the eye irritation test using a rabbit (Agricultural-Chemicals abstracts), it was set as the outside of Category.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Since skin changes that matches diagnosis criteria of mild irritation were not observed in the skin irritation test on rabbits (Agricultural-Chemicals abstracts), it was classified as out of Category.

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Classified as Category 1 because the Maximization test using guinea pigs (agrochemical abstract) showed 100% of positive rate.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (kidney, nervous system, liver, testis)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: The cell infiltration in the kidney was observed in the oral study using rat, and cholinergic neuroexcitatory symptoms,  liver cirrhosis, atrophy of hepatocytes, atrophy of spermatid or the inhibition of the spermatogenesis and the chronic nephropathies were observed in the oral study using dog with the each given dose within the guidance value range of Category 2 (all were Agricultural Chemicals abstracts), so it is considered that the kidney, nervous systems, liver, and testes are target organs, and they were classified into Category 2 (kidney, nervous system, liver, testes).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Tremors in oral, percutaneous and inhalational exposure tests in rats, clonic convulsions in an oral administration test and increased hyperreactivity to touch in an inhalation exposure test were observed respectively at the dose within the guidance values for Category 2 (Agricultural Chemical Abstracts). So the substance was classified as Category 2 (nervous system) because it is considered to affect the nervous system.
